Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the significance of the photo of invitations to register to vote sent to international students in Nova Scotia, suggesting that it raises concerns about non-citizens being able to vote in federal elections.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that non-citizens can vote in Canadian federal elections.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photo of invitations sent to international students indicates that non-citizens are eligible to vote, without providing concrete proof.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim suggests that the government might be rigging the electoral system to win extra votes, without considering alternative explanations or providing evidence to support this claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that foreign citizens living in Canada are not allowed to register to vote in provincial or federal elections.
Understate: The claim may understate the significance of the photo and the concerns raised by some individuals on social media, as it dismisses them as a "non-issue" without thoroughly addressing or investigating the matter.
